metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11521 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SdpContents::Session::Medium::parse function in resip/stack/SdpContents.cxx in reSIProcate 1.10.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by triggering many media connections. Gregor Jasny discovered that reSIProcate incorrectly handled a large number of media connections. A remote attacker could exploit by triggering many media connections to cause reSIProcate to crash, resulting in a denial of service (memory consumption).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librecon-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
libresiprocate-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
libresiprocate-turn-client-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
repro - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
resiprocate-turn-server - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
sipdialer - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: resiprocate package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1').
